descriptionSet.description: On this lobby card for the Hindi movie "Suhaag", released in 1979, two of the leading actors, Parveen Babi and Shashi Kapoor, can be seen driving in a jeep together. He is sitting behind the steering wheel while she is lying atop the frame of the jeep. Parveen Babi is wearing a pink dress and Shashi Kapoor is wearing a matching pink shirt, a white vest and a white scarf tied around his neck. To the left of the image is an illustration of Amitabh Bachchan and to the right is an illustration of Shashi Kapoor. Below the image is an illustration of Amjad Khan and Nirupa Roy.

inscription.text: Manmohan Desai's Suhaag Eastmancolor Music Laxmikant Pyarelal Lyrics Anand Bakshi Produced by Prakash Trehan & Subhash Sharma

description-en: On this lobby card for the Hindi movie "Suhaag", released in 1979, two of the leading actors, Parveen Babi and Shashi Kapoor, can be seen driving in a jeep together. He is sitting behind the steering wheel while she is lying atop the frame of the jeep. Parveen Babi is wearing a pink dress and Shashi Kapoor is wearing a matching pink shirt, a white vest and a white scarf tied around his neck. To the left of the image is an illustration of Amitabh Bachchan and to the right is an illustration of Shashi Kapoor. Below the image is an illustration of Amjad Khan and Nirupa Roy. (gs/tb/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie from the website imdb: Durga and Vikram Singh have been married for years. Vikram has taken to crime in a big way, and as a result has antagonized a rival gangster, Jaggi. Durga gives birth to twins, and Jaggi steals one of them, and sells him to a bootlegger, Pascal. Durga is upset when she finds her son missing, but is devastated when Vikram abandons her. With a lot of difficulty, Durga brings up her son, Kishan, and has given up on finding her other son. Kishan has grown up and is now a dedicated police officer. On the other hand, Pascal has exploited Amit, kept him illiterate, doing petty crime, and alcoholic. This gets him in confrontation with Kishan, but ironically the two settle their differences and become fast friends. Vikram is still alive, and is not aware of his two sons and wife being alive. Without revealing his identity, he hires Amit to kill Kishan during a Navratri dance at Maa Sherawali's temple... cf. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0079963/ (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0079963/, story plot, leading actors, director, last accessed 2011-12-29. (gs)
